intro: Laserpitium bavaricum, commonly known as the Bavarian lasur grass, is a flowering plant native to Central and Southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are narrow and grass-like. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
